fields.description:
Easiest way to see is that the "Check JIRA issues with null status" test runs the following SQL:

{code}SELECT jiraissue.ID, jiraissue.pkey, jiraissue.issuestatus, jiraissue.PROJECT, jiraissue.issuetype, currentStep.STEP_ID FROM public.jiraissue jiraissue LEFT JOIN public.OS_CURRENTSTEP currentStep ON jiraissue.WORKFLOW_ID = currentStep.ENTRY_ID WHERE jiraissue.issuestatus IS NULL{code}

Should be:

{code}SELECT jiraissue.ID, concat_ws('-',project.pkey,jiraissue.issuenum), jiraissue.issuestatus, jiraissue.PROJECT, jiraissue.issuetype, currentStep.STEP_ID 
FROM public.jiraissue jiraissue 
LEFT JOIN public.OS_CURRENTSTEP currentStep ON jiraissue.WORKFLOW_ID = currentStep.ENTRY_ID
JOIN public.project project on project.id=jiraissue.project
WHERE jiraissue.issuestatus IS NULL{code}

We should audit the other queries in the plugin and update them as well to get the PKEY correctly.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker has not been updated for new PKEY location

fields.description:
When moving an issue with sub-task/s to a different project, if that project is associated with an Issue Security Scheme (ISSCH), the sub-task/s will not be moved. The consequence is the parent issue belongs to the new project while its sub-task/s still belong to the original project. There are several possible variants:
# If the original project is not associated with an ISSCH or associated with a different ISSCH (different sets of security levels):
#* If no security level is set for the parent issue in the new project, the sub-task/s will still be accessible (viewable)
!seclv1.png|thumbnail!
#* If a security level is set for the parent issue in the new project, the sub-task/s will be no longer accessible
!seclv2.png|thumbnail!
!seclv3.png|thumbnail!
# If the original project is associated with the same ISSCH as the destination project, the sub-task/s will be accessible and inherit the parent issue's security level but still belong to the original project
!seclv4.png|thumbnail!

Expected behavior: As sub-tasks inherit their parent's security level, they should be moved with the parent to whichever projects while still inheriting the parent's security level (if available).
fields.summary: Sub-tasks not moved with parent issues to other projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36672].
  {panel}

h3. Problem:

We no longer have updated docs for classes such as https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/5.1.8/reference/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/mail/handlers/package-summary.html from JIRA 5.1.8 onwards.

The code is still there, however it's not part of the official docs as the majority of JIRA code is focusing on moving to plugins and the plugin documentation is not considered to be part of the main JIRA API docs (ie the devs don't consider this to be the main API of JIRA). In JIRA we have a package that contains the main API classes and those are the ones we use ourselves. These mail handler docs rely on that API package - that is the official API. We also have a lot of classes that we expose, which means plugin devs can use them, however don't mark them as being part of the official API.

Plugin devs could use the exposed classes, however they're not supposed to and should be using the API instead. This is the risk of using them - they are not official and may not continue to be documented or supported and can change any versions. Official API will always be documented and always supported. It will change, however it will be for major versions only (part of the whole stable API thing) and also have all the details displayed. I've been told this is not a deliberate decision, just a side effect of moving code out of JIRA core and into plugins. As it has been moved, docs are no longer publicly available.

In this example, they should be using https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest/com/atlassian/jira/service/util/handler/MessageHandler.html a it is official. We have an example at [Custom Message (Mail) Handler for JIRA|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Custom+Message+(Mail)+Handler+for+JIRA].

h3. Request

Can you please publish Javadocs for plugins that used to be part of JIRA core, or mention this in the JIRA release notes for plugin developers so they aren't left in the dark.

Thanks :)
fields.summary: Java Docs are missing for certain classes as they have moved from jira-core into jira-plugins

I am vi user, like many JIRA users are.

I hit escape frequently when I'm done typing. When I'm editing a issue (story) description in JIRA and I don't explicitly click save, I lose my edits.

This seems like a bug. The expected behavior would be to either lose focus and save the content, or show some sort of popup confirming that I want to lose the content. I should not lose all the content of the edit with a single keystroke.

 

*Workaround*

Use Rich Text editor that is available since Jira 7.3.0 (and onwards). Clicking escape in the Visual edit mode does not discard the comment.

fields.description:
The AJS.SingleSelect component has a couple of configuration options that aren't compatible with each-other.

You can set a placeholder value for the SingleSelect by providing an element such as {{<option data-placeholder="true">}}. This will add placeholder text to the SingleSelect. The placeholder text will be present whenever a valid value isn't selected, or when the control is being edited as free-text and the input field has no value.

If you set the SingleSelect option "revertOnInvalid" to true, the SingleSelect will throw an error whenever you:

# Create the SingleSelect such that the placeholder is selected initially (e.g., by initially not selecting any value or selecting an invalid value)
# Focus the SingleSelect, then
# Unfocus the SingleSelect.

Essentially, the problem is caused because of two things:
* When the placeholder value is 'selected', there's no descriptor object for it.
# the revertOnInvalid option doesn't check that the current value is the placeholder, so attempts to set the control's value with a null descriptor.
fields.summary: SingleSelect sometimes throws errors when placeholder value used

fields.summary: Login failure with internal JIRA user

fields.description:
We just upgraded our Jira system from Jira 4.4.5 to Jira 6.1.5. Everything went smoothly without any hiccups and in fact we are very pleased with the upgrade and the new features. However, from the past week or so after users started using the system hitting every feature in the process, the existing feature of attaching a screenshot is not working with a caveat. Some users were able to run the Java plug-in update as prompted and the popup works just fine i.e. they are able to attach a screenshot without issues. Some users are just not able to. See screenshot with the specific issue they are seeing. The users have updated their local machines to JDK7, they've uninstalled JDK7 back to JDK6 but to no avail. On systems where this feature works, we were prompted to upgrade to JDK7 and it worked without issues.

We have about 100 active users with most of them offshore and is delaying the QA process as they are now having to save the screenshots as an image and then attach it.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot feature failing for end users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36646].
  {panel}

When first logging in to JIRA, the last dashboard the user accessed is displayed via the URL:
 
https://domain.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa

The dashboard ID is not listed.  It would be useful if the ID was displayed in the URL, so that it could be copied/pasted, like:

https://domain.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=16122
fields.summary: Full URL to dashboard should be displayed on last dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36645].
  {panel}

Currently the following features are available:
* Email subscriptions for Issue Filters
* Excel export for Issue Filters

Customers might want to combine these two features in a sense that an excel export file of a specific filter will be attached to the emails sent periodically to a subscribed email address.
fields.summary: Excel attachments for Filter subscriptions
Automatically roll back to pre upgrade state

fields.description:
I'm having a problem using mylyn jira connector with jira 6.1

I have some queries configured, which work, but now I can't add a new query. I've tried adding the same query as a filter import and using the eclipse form.

In both cases I get the following error message, even though the query itself doesn't contain any percent characters:

    Error in the JQL Query: The character '%' is a reserved JQL character. You must enclose it in a string or use the escape '\u0025' instead. (line 1, character 13)


see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21041933/how-to-solve-the-character-is-a-reserved-jql-character-error
fields.summary: Mylyn-JIRA connector: The character '%' is a reserved JQL character excepion
After renaming users in JIRA, worklogs do not expand author correctly in REST API

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36637].
  {panel}

Our users have been assigned to new groups on the basis of a corporate restructuring. The group names have been used for sharing filters, dashboards and comments.

If I delete the old groups, then JIRA asks for a new group name so that shared comments can be changed to the new group. That's great!

Unfortunately, this does not apply shared filters and dashboards. The filters and dashboards are no longer shared for other users.

Therefore, we have stopped deleting the groups. However, new employees are not added to the old groups. This will end in chaos, because we do not know exactly whether groups are still needed or not. The system becomes increasingly cluttered.

It would be nice if the shares of filters and dashboards could be changed to a different group, if groups are deleted. So just as it is already done for comments.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Values for select custom fields are not imported when using the project import tool. (*System* > *Project Import*). 

This is due to the fact that the import tool is expecting two internal ID's to match, which under most circumstances is the case, but can differ.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate an XML Backup a JIRA instance. 
# In the target environment, set up a project to import the data to. 
# Import a JIRA Project issue that uses a Custom Select list within it's configuration. 
# In some cases, the custom values will not be available.

h3. Expected Results

When the Project is imported, that issues from the imported project contain their original values for a Select list or checkbox.

h3. Actual Results

The issues from the project may not contain their original values from the select list or checkbox from the origin project. 

h3. Workaround
A workaround can be achieved through the steps in: [Custom field values are not imported using Project Importers Tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Custom+field+values+are+not+imported+using+Project+Importers+Tool]. Please note that this workaround does involve a database change, and as a result we recommend a full backup is taken before completing the documented procedure.
fields.summary: Project Import does not import Custom Field Select Option values

fields.description:
While using an openldap backend to manage JIRA users, it sticks to use JIRA bind DN to perform the "Change Password" task rather than the authenticated DN of current logined user.

For some security reasons, the JIRA bind DN is granted limited privileges (such as authenticate, and reading specified fields of a directory) just for binding purpose. Under commonly crics, the user has the write privileges to his/her "userPassword" attribute in the directory. So JIRA should provide an option to use the authenticated user's DN to bind the directory while performing "Change Password".
fields.summary: Using User's Authenticated DN to perform "Change Password" in LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36605].
  {panel}

I was looking at a filter I'd created, and wondered what the ★ meant next to "Details". I clicked it, and suddenly everything disappeared — as though the filter had been deleted. This was very shocking — it was no longer in the Issues menu, it wasn't under Favourite Filters (on the left), and when I click "Manage Filters" it wasn't there either. I eventually realised it was under the "My" category in "Manage Filters", but it was a jarring experience.

I propose that when you unfavourite a filter that you're currently looking at, you remain looking at it.

Check the attachments for a video demonstration.

h5. Testing notes
Details of Test Heuristics can be found at http://go/stopsu 

*Stress*
* Sequential clicks to favourite and unfavourite a filter

*Time* 
* Render an existing filter, delete it in another window, refresh the first page

*Operations* 
* N/A

*Platform* 
* JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 7.0
* IE 9-11, Firefox, Chrome, Safari

*Security* 
* N/A

*Usability* 
* Star icon should always be visible, representing the expected state: on or off
* A filter can be removed or favourited using the sidebar, the following scenarios are expected:
** A filter is favourited using the sidebar: star state should reflect the new state
** A filter is removed using the sidebar: search header should be updated to reflect this state
* (Un)Favourite action should be a two-way update between the sidebar and the header.

*Other*
* N/A
fields.summary: When unfavouriting an issue filter that you're currently using, it disappears!

Using JQL in the issue navigator, if you auto complete a field and go on to try and search another, it will not auto-complete without quotes around the first result.

fields.description:
Dears.

I have an instance of Jira running in our servers, but we are studying to migrate the Jira to the atlassian ondemand cloud.
We started a test instance (one month trial) and I have imported all of our projects to the cloud.
We decide to use only one of this imported projects in the trial phase and in the second phase to use all projects in the cloud.
To do it, I need to test if is possible to export the project, which will be used in the first phase, and to import it again definitively in the second phase (after all projects were imported again from current production).
But when I am testing this approach I got the error 404 in the URL
https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/views/ExternalImport1.jspa
This error happens when I click on the item "Import External Project" in the menu " Projects".

Please, could someone help me?

Thanks,

Augusto

PS: I follow the suggetion at
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/252021/import-external-project-ondemand-cloud

Jason%20Worley%20%5BAtlassian%5D
Jason Worley [Atlassian] · 2,742 karma · 2 hours ago

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36597].
  {panel}

Your function http://jira-python.readthedocs.org/en/latest/_modules/jira/client.html#JIRA.add_user_to_group

contains the line:
`if content.find('class="error">':`

The find command returns `-1` if the string is not found, which registers as `True` and triggers the if-statement.  I assume you want something like:

`if content.find('class="error">') != -1:
fields.summary: if content.find('string'): will always trigger (jira.add_user_to_group)

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up an LDAP directory, and rank it higher than the internal directory
# Create a user in the internal directory, called B
# Rename user A in LDAP to B
# Synchronise

h4. Expected Results

# B in the internal directory gets renamed to B#1 in the app_user table
# A gets renamed to B in the app_user table
# Everything associated with both users becomes merged as the highest priority user

h4. Actual Results

# User rename appears like it's occurred fine, in the app_user table the internal user becomes A#1, and the LDAP user becomes A
# Everything associated with both users becomes merged as the highest priority user
# JIRA inconsistently recognises the B#2 in different aspects of the interface, it doesn't show up in the User Browser, but shows in certain Issue Attributes e.g Assignee or Reporter.
# It is confusing to most Admins to suddenly see issue attributes automatically changing to B#2 when they have created no such user.
# You're not able to login as B#2 to automatically regain access to the issues.
# You are not able to use B#2 in the basic search, but then it shows up in Advanced JQL.
# If you do a basic search with assignee set to B, then switch to Advanced JQL, the interface will not switch back to Basic

h4. Notes

Due to the way this handling works, you can't deliberately have a username that ends with # followed by any number. It gets created, and appears in the user list, but you can't find it in any user browser drop down, and if you try to assign anything to that user you get an error "User 'user#1' cannot be assigned issues".
fields.summary: Usernames in issue attributes suddenly showing up with a #1 suffix after LDAP synchronization and causing various undesired effects

fields.description:
Lets say you have jira_user_A who has the *Manage Watchers permission* in project_A, but does not have the *Browse Users* global permission.

jira_user_A can still add a watcher to issues by way of typing the user's username in full, and pressing enter, although he does not get auto-suggestions, as expected, because he does not have Browse Users global permission.

This does not work for Internet Explorer 8. In IE8 you are unable to press enter (it does nothing) and the following error is seen: [^IE8.jpg]. It is also broken if you have the Browse Users permission, but in this case you can atleast click on the auto-suggestions to add users.

In Chrome, it works just fine: [^Chrome1.jpg]

h3. Workaround

You can still edit the watchers list by using the Manage Watchers page instead. Alternatively, you can use more recent versions of Internet Explorer or any of the other supported browsers.
fields.summary: Problem adding watchers in IE 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36591].
  {panel}

Consider the case where an issue is discovered in a previously archived version. In this scenario, one would want to set the Affects Version field to that archived version. However, archived versions cannot be selected in version picker fields. The workaround is to un-archive the version, add it to the Affects Version, and then re-archive the version. This adds seemingly unnecessary effort that could be avoided by slightly changing the requirements for archived versions.

One possible solution would be to add another section at the end of the Affects Version drop down list for "Archived Versions", similar to "Released Versions" and "Unreleased Versions". Putting this section at the bottom of the list helps keep it farther out of reach, but still allows one to select archived versions if necessary.

Another possible solution would be to allow manual entry of an archived version, without displaying it in the drop down list.

Allowing project administrators to enable/disable selecting archived versions would be a plus.
fields.summary: Allow adding archived versions as Affects Versions

fields.description: We have recently switched to JIRA On-Demand and have set up Zendesk for our Customer Service front end. Inside of Zendesk you can see the ticket sharing and the projects that you want to link to but the ticket never gets created.

fields.description:
A user of ours tried to attach a screen capture to an issue using the screenshot applet feature of JIRA (accessible by the _More_ button, _Attach screenshot_ menu item).

Since he has updated his Java plugin, he could not use this feature anymore, because the plugin raised the following exception:
{panel:title=SecurityException|titleBGColor=#FF0000|bgColor=#FF9999}
Missing required Permissions manifest attribute in main jar:
https://example.com/secure/applet/screenshot.jar
{panel}

Recently (January 2014), [Oracle made the Permissions attribute mandatory in the Manifest|https://blogs.oracle.com/java-platform-group/entry/new_security_requirements_for_rias]; yet it is absent from the MANIFEST.MF found in screenshot.jar bundled with JIRA (6.0.4 and 6.1.6 were checked).

I guess this could very well be the root of the problem we hit.

*Workaround*
Add the URL used to access JIRA (including the port, if changed) in Java's Exception Site List, according to the instructions from their website: http://www.java.com/en/download/help/java_blocked.xml
fields.summary: Screenshot applet cannot be used with Java 7u51 plugin

fields.description:
In our Project we have defined diffrent versions (1,2,3,4) and Components (A, B, C).

Now when I want to change the Affected Version, Fixed Version or Components field by using the following steps i get an error message (Example :*Version with id '1' does not exists*).

The steps are

1. Open Issue
2. Click on Affected Version field to edit it
3. Type in a Version (in my case i typed 1) -> ComboBox opens and displays all version matching the input
4. Click outside of the editing field to confirm the change
5. Error message is displayed

In the Edit Issue View i can use the steps above to confirm my edit without getting an error
fields.summary: Fixed Version, Affected Version and Components fields in Issue View are not working as in Edit Issue View

fields.description:
We use a precommig hook to prevent checkins on issues which have been closed.
It works without problems for issues which have been created and closed.
It does not work if an issue has ben closed, reopened and closed.

Our research suggests that the problem may be that the Jira-Commit-Acceptance-Plugin checks for a resolution-object which seems to be missing for issues which have been reopened/closed.

(https://github.com/terabyte/Jira-Commit-Acceptance-Plugin/blob/master/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/ext/commitacceptance/server/evaluator/predicate/AreIssuesUnresolvedPredicate.java, line 26)
Reopened-Closed issue
select * from jiraissue where pkey = 'LNCORE-13464' limit 5;
-> Resolution = NULL, Resolutiondate = NULL
Closed issue
select * from jiraissue where pkey = 'LNCORE-13416' limit 5;
-> RESOLUTION = 1, Resolutiondate = 2013-10-15 16:13:16

Atlassian Universal Plugin Manager Plugin  2.14.1
JIRA Commit Acceptance Plugin              1.6.0
JIRA iCalendar Plugin                             1.1
JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM)                    5.0.4
JIRA Subversion plugin                          0.10.13
QMetry Plug-in for JIRA                         2.3
Support Tools Plugin                              3.0.25
fields.summary: Jira-Commit-Acceptance-Plugin allows to checkin code for an issue which is closed if it has been reopened inbetween

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a mixed-case username in an issue filter it will prevent you from using Basic mode and force you to stay in advanced mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new filter.
# Enter a mixed-case user, for example {{DavidCurrie}}.

h3. Expected Results

The basic button can be used.

h3. Actual Results

The basic button will grey out.

h3. Workaround

Changing the username to lower-case, e.g.: {{davidcurrie}} will let you use basic mode again. This will not work if you have separate users with different casing, e.g.: {{davidcurrie}} & {{DavidCurrie}}.
fields.summary: Using a mixed-case username in a filter will prevent switching back to a basic search

Please see the attachment to understand the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
- Ensure there are at least two users in the system
- create two custom fields 'a' and 'b' of type 'user picker' and ensure they are visible on the create screen
- populate both with data by choosing user
- click to view issue and click on the inline edit for the field between reporter and the second custom field (should be field 'a') . Type a few letters to make the dropdown autopopulate suggestions. 
- At this point you will see the field value of field 'b' can be seen as if the dropdown is transparent.

This has been tested on latest version of chrome and firefox. User has also tested on internet explorer (and also on his mobile device).

Install a previous version of the Java update.
